data.title: Heber City Utah
data.text:
Heber City began as an agricultural community in the mid 1800s, but has grown into a popular tourist destination and one of the best places to live in Utah. About 16,000 people live in Heber City, with many more visiting for skiing and winter sports during part of the year, and fishing, hunting, hiking, and more during the warmer months.

Just 45 minutes southeast of Salt Lake City, Heber City offers the charm and natural beauty of a mountain ski town with the convenience of a major city nearby for shopping, dining, entertainment, healthcare, and travel. It even ranked first among the best places to live in Wasatch County!

What to Do in Heber City

Heber City is known as a premier skiing and snowboarding destination. There are many nearby ski resorts, including:

Deer Valley Resort

Mayflower Ski Resort

Solitude Mountain Resort

Sundance Ski Resort

Just 15 minutes from Heber City is Deer Valley State Park, where visitors can enjoy the beautiful scenery all year round. In the summer months, Heber City residents and vacationers love to windsurf, swim, boat, zip line, and fish at Deer Valley Reservoir. Enjoy cross country skiing and snowshoeing in the winter, or hiking in the warmer months on the 8 mile Deer Creek Trail, or camp in the beautiful state park.

Uinta-Wasatch Cache National Forest is also nearby, just 25 minutes away. Encompassing over 2 million acres of ecologically diverse land, you’ll be back again and again to enjoy the outdoor adventure and breathtaking landscape.

To see some of the history of the region, visit Heber Valley Railroad. Though it stopped operating commercially in 1967, you can take a 16 mile ride on the train and enjoy the beautiful views of the area, including Cascade Mountain and Mount Timpanogos.

For a delicious meal, try out Back 40 or Hideout Steakhouse.

Why People Love Living in Heber City

Many people love Heber City because it offers all of the winter adventure and scenic views of larger ski resort towns like Park City, but without the traffic or crowds. As a smaller ski destination, it maintains the cozy, small town charm with a tight knit community.

Of course, residents of Heber City enjoy access to some of the best skiing, snowboarding, hiking, fishing, and hunting in the state, while being just a short drive from other Utah ski resorts and destinations.

With close proximity to Salt Lake City and Provo, living in Heber City means having convenient access to healthcare facilities, airports, and retail that isn’t present in the city limits.

Heber City Schools

Heber City offers excellent public schools, with some of the most highly rated schools in the state. Public schools in Heber City are a part of Wasatch County School District.

There is also a private special education academy in Heber City to support families of children who need extra support.

Additionally, Utah education law supports families who choose to homeschool by providing public funding for non-religious curriculum and essential school supplies.

Heber City Real Estate

Real estate in Heber City is competitive, as it is one of the best places to live in Utah and highly desirable because of the beautiful scenery, excellent schools, and charming community. Most homes in Heber City are mostly single family homes with large lots to showcase the beautiful mountain setting.

There is a limited selection of condos and townhomes in Heber City, with some new construction cabins under development, as well.

For more information about buying a home in Utah, or to begin the process of relocating to Utah, contact us today! As a lifelong Utah resident and experienced real estate professional, my team and I are ready to help.

To buy in Heber City, Utah call us directly at 801-410-7917
